text: The Calabrian regional election of 1970 took place on 7–8 June 1970. ==Events== Christian Democracy was by far the largest party and Christian Democrat Antonio Guarasci formed a government with the support of the Italian Socialist Party and the other minor centre-left parties (organic Centre-left). Guarasci was replaced by Aldo Ferrara in 1974. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%" |- bgcolor="EFEFEF" ! colspan=2|Parties ! votes ! votes (%) ! seats |- | bgcolor=White | | Christian Democracy | align=right|374,215 | align=right|39.7 | align=right|17 |- | bgcolor=Red | | Italian Communist Party | align=right|218,845 | align=right|23.2 | align=right|10 |- | bgcolor=Hotpink | | Italian Socialist Party | align=right|132,898 | align=right|14.1 | align=right|6 |- | bgcolor=Black | | Italian Social Movement | align=right|59,607 | align=right|6.3 | align=right|2 |- | bgcolor=Pink | | Unitary Socialist Party | align=right|48,153 | align=right|5.1 | align=right|2 |- | bgcolor=Lime | | Italian Republican Party | align=right|38,812 | align=right|4.1 | align=right|1 |- | bgcolor=Deeppink | | Italian Socialist Party of Proletarian Unity | align=right|37,381 | align=right|4.0 | align=right|1 |- | bgcolor=Blue | | Italian Liberal Party | align=right|25,197 | align=right|2.7 | align=right|1 |- |rowspan=2| | Italian Democratic Party of Monarchist Unity | align=right|4,067 | align=right|0.4 | align=right|- |- | Communist Party of Italy (Marxist–Leninist) | align=right|2,696 | align=right|0.3 | align=right|- |- |- bgcolor="EFEFEF" ! colspan=2|Total | align=right|941,871 | align=right|100.0 | align=right|40 |- !colspan=5|File:Calabria Council 1970.svg |- !colspan=5|Largest party by municipality |- !colspan=5|File:Calabria 1970.PNG |} Source: Ministry of the Interior Category:Elections in Calabria Category:1970 elections in Italy
title: 1970 Calabrian regional election
